abstract: Craig Dubow is leaving the struggling publisher of USA Today after 30 years because of chronic health problems.
snippet: Craig Dubow is leaving the struggling publisher of USA Today after 30 years because of chronic health problems.
lead_paragraph: 5:03 p.m. | Updated Craig A. Dubow, the chairman and chief executive of the Gannett Company, who had been on medical leave, resigned on Thursday for health reasons, the company said. Gracia C. Martore, the company’s president and chief operating officer, was named president and chief executive by the Gannett board.

headline.main: Dubow Steps Down at Gannett, Is Replaced by Martore
